result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L. Nubern

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 3:18 p.m. 
**Includes 14CM1846(Br.1 case), 15CF216, 15CM306(Br.1 case), 15CM307(Br.1 case), 15CM706 & 15CM862**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Kyle Reimann. Date & time set for Plea Hearing as the parties have reached an agreement to cover all files although 3 are Br.1 cases. State notes DA's office will not issue any criminal charges re: contempt committed on 04/21/15 by defendant. COURT APPROVES. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW.
State recites joint agreement and moves to:
PLEA: 14CM1846- Ct.1- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer>>GUILTY
                                Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct>>DRI
           15CF216- Ct.1- Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                            Ct.2- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer>>DRI
                            Ct.3- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer>>DRI
                            Ct.4- Battery (Domestic Abuse)>>DRI
                            Ct.5- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)>>DRI
                            Ct.6- Criminal Damage to Property>>DRI
                            Ct.7- Battery (Domestic Abuse)>>DRI
                            Ct.8- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)>>DRI
                            Ct.9- Battery (Domestic Abuse)>>DRI
                            Ct.10- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                            Ct.11- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                            Ct.12- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                            Ct.13- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                            Ct.14- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                            Ct.15- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
          15CM306- Ct.1- Disorderly Conduct>>DRI
                             Ct.2- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
          15CM307- Ct.1- Battery>>GUILTY
                             Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct>>DRI
                             Ct.3- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
          15CM706- Ct.1- Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints>>GUILTY
                             Ct.2- Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints>>DRI
                             Ct.3- Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints>>DRI
                             Ct.4- Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints>>DRI
                             Ct.5- Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints>>DRI
                             Ct.6- Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints>>DRI
                             Ct.7- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                             Ct.8- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                             Ct.9- Bail Jumping (Misd)>> DRI
         15CM862- Ct.1- Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction>>GUILTY
                            Ct.2- Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction>>GUILTY
                            Ct.3- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
                            Ct.4- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>DRI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF216, Ct.1- I/S 4 years WI State Prison System, 2 years IC & 2 years ES. Defendant placed on probation for 2 years. CONDITIONS: Completion of SAFE program and anger management classes, participate in any classes or counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both and if not, complete 10 hours CS per week, any issues of contact with victim, C.H. to be monitored at agent's discretion, DNA sample and surcharge & CC.
COURT FURTHER ORDERS: 14CM1846- Ct.1, 15CM307- Ct.1, 15CM706- Ct.1, & 15CM862- Ct.1 & Ct.2- 67 days MCJ on each count concurrent to each other with credit for 67 days plus CC & DNA surcharge.
DNA sample ordered on 15CM706 & 15CM862. 
Adj: 3:39 p.m.

Case Called: 3:56 pm
Includes 14CM1846, 15CF216, 15CM306, 15CM307, 15CM706.
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in custody and with Atty Kyle Reimann.
Date and time set for Arraignment in 15CF216 and Initial Appearance in 15CM706.
Atty Reimann states that they do not want to continue with Arraignment at this time due to the Defendant's Request for Substitution.
Originial Information has been filed in 15CF216. 

COURT notes that the Arraignment date in 15CF216 and the Initial Appearance in 15CM706 are to be rescheduled when assigned to new court.

State provides COURT with No Contact Orders.
Atty Reimann states that the No Contact was waived once before and would object to Order the No Contact. 
COURT ORDERS: COURT signs No Contact Order and to have no contact with C.H. 

Adj: 4:05 pm

INCLUDES 15CM306 and 15CM307.    No contact with victim(s):  C.H. (waivable) and V.E.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
